page.title: 08INFLUENCES:TOURISM, QUINTON
page.content: Quinton's position about six miles South of{Stratford upon Avon}renders it somewhat subject to the summer influx, especially, of{visitors}to the historic{national treasures.}There is all the local association with the famous bard,{William Shakespeare. Some local inhabitants are able to offer tourists facilities for{caravan, {camp sites and accommodation. }There are some well- known local{hostelries with period charm.There are several valuable{historic listed buildings locally, and the{National Trust}holds many properties within easy reach of the area. Not only is the area rich as a {national resource,}but tourists travelling from the North East to the South West and Wales pass through the area and are able to enjoy a delightful part of England.
